name: flanker
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in rugby, one of two attacking players who hold onto the sides of a scrum (= a group of attacking players from each team who come together with their heads down and arms joined, and push against each other) : Tries were scored by flanker Jonathan Griffiths. New Zealand's most famous flanker intends to retire from rugby at the end of the year.
in American football, an attacking player who is usually on the outer edge of the line of scrimmage (= the line on which the ball is positioned at the beginning of play): He spent his career with the 49ers as a flanker. Synonyms
wide receiver
wideout
More examplesFewer examplesThe New Zealand-born flanker was declared fit late on Monday. The replacement flanker scored Gloucester's second try.He is a quarterback turned flanker.As a flanker, he will frequently be put in motion and will also line up in the slot.
